reviews.review_msg: Boring lectures but attendance is necessary. Easy grading. The only thing I didn't like was that he does not mark participation fairly. If you have group conflict, just endure it even if you're the one carrying or else you'll get a lower participation mark for "not attempting to resolve" your group conflict lol.

Bill is an amazing professor. He gives great support to his students, replying to emails within the day. He gives clear rubrics which makes it possible to do well on assignments. We had to do 1 report, 1 presentation, a term paper which is more like a reflection, then a short reflection paper, and make a team charter. I highly recommend this course

William (Bill) Scott is honestly one of the best Beedie professors I have ever met. I took BUS 488 with him virtually this past semester due to COVID and it was such a great class. The nature of the class is already supposed to be highly interactive and engaging but Bill was able to incorporate those components really well into the online lectures.

This class was an absolute waste of time and money, we sat in a room and did nothing but discuss pointless group goals with each other. It baffles me that a university would charge money for this class.

It's easy if that's what you're looking for but you will learn nothing. A complete waste of time.
Easy class, but you have to attend every single lecture. Professor can be arrogant and says whatever is on his mind, even if it isn't appropriate.

Class wasn't hard at all, grade is comprised of 2 reflection papers (25% each), a take home final (30%), and participation (20%). If you go to lectures and can apply basic self reflection in your papers, you will do great in this course! Not necessarily fond of Gervase as a person (somewhat arrogant), but easy course nonetheless.
Awesome prof: visionary. He has clear points to make, well recognized professional. His teaching could open up your mind if you try to understand and apply it. Up to you to try - it's your life!

During 488 Gervase really makes you look at yourself and your behaviours. He gives great feedback and I use the skills that I learnt from him everyday. You need to go into this class with an open mind and you will grow as a student and as a person.

Extremely unorganized and never emails you back even after reading them (or so he says). I have learned nothing over the course of this semester. Unable to justify his marking (letter grade). Should not be a professor. An embarrassment to SFU.
Excellent course! Gained considerable insight about team effectiveness and group dynamics.

Very nice guy but extremely boring.  Always goes off topic and ends up lecturing about random things.  Doesn't use any kind of powerpoint slides or visuals - have to write down everything he says.  I would not recommend him if you have a short attention. His exams are all multiple choice but the questions are quite difficult and confusing.

Take her for BUS488 if you have the chance!! She's funny and her lectures are engaging. Her grading criteria is super clear, marking is pretty fair and has fast response time. Midterm 20%, final 20%, 2 group presentations and a research paper. By far my favourite business professor at Beedie.
She is nice, but please be careful to listen to the lecture!
